comments.text:
"You single-handedly brought us to the verge of total planetary destruction, years ahead of schedule. And, for that, we sentence you to nine years in prison!"
"Oh no!!!"

comments.text: Fuchs gets nine years for giving the Soviets everything, the Rosenbergs were executed for information on a fuse.
comments.author: @dennisdilmore7115

comments.text:
Fuchs had returned to the UK before he was identified by MI5 as a possible spy. He was only charged with espionage, not treason, because the Soviet Union was technically still an ally when he passed on the information. he also passed the same information to the British. 14 years was the maximum sentence for espionage in Britain at the time.
I'm currently reading Defend the Realm, the authorized history of MI5 by Christopher Andrew.
